Position Overview

Autodesk Consulting is seeking a talented Consulting Delivery Manager with responsibilities for Autodesk Customer Success Services portfolios. This is a senior level position within the Autodesk Consulting organization and represents an exciting opportunity to be a critical part of the dynamic services management team at Autodesk.

Responsibilities
  • Drive opportunities for growth in Architecture, Engineering, Construction and Manufacturing portfolios in ANZ
  • Lead direction for identification, scoping, and proposing solution offerings that provide valuable business outcomes for Autodesk customers
  • Drive opportunities for growth in Architecture, Engineering, Construction and Manufacturing portfolios in ANZ
  • Lead direction for identification, scoping, and proposing solution offerings that provide valuable business outcomes for Autodesk customers
  • Promote repeatable packaged services offerings to sales
  • Collaborate with the Package Service Offering team to harvest and/or use packaged solutions
  • Review project plans, schedules, and project control tools utilizing standard PM and PSA software. Perform project plan analysis and evaluate risk and mitigation plans
  • Define project resource plans, including internal and contract resources during proposal and contracting and delivery phases
  • Serve as the project escalation path for project managers. Attend project steering committee meetings and conduct end of project quality reviews
  • Monitor projects portfolios to ensure completion within defined schedule, budget, and quality parameters
  • Help team members establish open, collaborative relationships. Maintain enthusiasm, energy and focus across projects. Translate project objectives and vision into clear goals for the team
  • Develop strong client and stakeholder relationships and maintain effective communication channels
  • Assist Consulting Partner Manager in development, onboarding and maintaining relationships with new Delivery partners and system integrators

  • Support revenue recognition process

Minimum Qualifications
  • Ability to oversee delivery of consulting and project management services for more than 50 concurrent projects
  • Strong leadership, communication, interpersonal, planning, and organization skills
  • Deep knowledge of Project Management, PMP certification desirable
  • Ability to engage customer at business level, drive alignment and execution
  • Ability to build customer relationships to achieve the trusted advisor status

  • Proven ability to facilitate and document process discussions
  • Ability to be highly effective in a matrix management organization
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Located in Sydney and able to travel 50% (domestic and international)

About Autodesk

With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

Senior Project Manager | Information Technology

About Us

Founded in 1924, Woolworths Group is Australia's largest retailer with more than 3,500 stores across Australia and New Zealand that span food, drinks, petrol, general merchandise and hotels.

The Woolworths Group is a proud, home-grown Australian business, employer of more than 205,000 people and a committed business partner of many thousand local farmers, producers and manufacturers. From retail operations at the heart of every community in Australia to commercial and expertise support functions that operate globally we’re a large company with a heart - our people are everything.

About The Role

The primary purpose of the Senior Project Manager role, is to lead and deliver critical business projects, working end to end across IT and the business to ensure the relevant business needs of stakeholders are met and aligns to vision and ambitions for the Group.

This is a technology focused Project Management role, but requires close engagement with business stakeholders and operational teams.

About You

Woolworths people are great people. Whether we’re learning new things, seizing the initiative, or winning together our customers are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re the sort of individual who takes accountability and strives to always do the right thing for each other, our communities, our customers, and our business then we ought to connect.

What You'll Do
  • Lead and manage project plans, including scope, schedule, resources and project deliverables
  • Manage and lead cross-functional teams in order to successfully deliver projects on time and according to the quality requirements
  • Manage the project schedule, budget, scope, quality and risk to ensure successful delivery
  • Monitor and control each phase and steps of project implementation
  • Identify and report project issues and project risks to the relevant individuals
  • Find solutions to mitigate and/or minimise project risks and other issues
  • Prepare and deliver project management deliverables to the appropriate steering
  • Work closely with Business and IT teams to meet business requirements and
  • Navigate and work across complex work environment and teams to deliver outcomes

To be considered for this role, you should have the following competencies-
  • Strong project management (>5 years) with experience in a multi-brand and/or large complex organisation
  • Experience working on multiple IT projects end to end >$10M
  • A strong track record in leading and delivering quality outcomes
  • Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills and ability to influence key personnel at varying levels of the organisation
  • Retail experience will be highly regarded
  • Leadership experience, managing small teams >15 members.
  • Expertise in leading the design, implementation and optimisation of ICT processes, organisations and systems
  • Demonstrated experience in delivering large scale, enterprise level IT projects
  • Demonstrated change management experience covering technical and process change
  • Able to navigate complex work environment and teams to deliver outcomes
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and streams of work

We’re social! - connect with us at #WOWcareers through LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram or via www.wowcareers.com.au

What will you do?

You’ll bring your technical skills to a product environment as a key member of the Digital team.

Postdoctoral Scientist

Company Name Peter MacCallum Cancer Centre Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

Outstanding candidates are encouraged to apply for positions now open at Peter MacCallum Cancer Centre – a place where our normal days are extraordinary; as are the people we care for.

The Peter MacCallum Cancer Centre is Australia’s only public hospital solely dedicated to cancer and one of an elite group of hospitals worldwide to have its own integrated cancer research program and laboratories.

Globally, we are facing one of the most pivotal times in the pursuit of cancer cures, and Peter Mac stands at its forefront. Together, we aim to lead a new era of cancer prevention, care and discovery, supported by state-of-the-art facilities at our new home within the Victorian Comprehensive Cancer Centre building.

Your role in our future.

An exciting opportunity exists for an enthusiastic and highly motivated postdoctoral scientist to join the laboratory of Dr Kristin Brown to investigate how metabolic reprogramming contributes to breast cancer development, progression and therapy resistance. This knowledge will be applied to the pre-clinical development of novel and more effective interventions for breast cancer therapy.

For more information on recent publications and projects running in the Brown laboratory refer to:

https://www.petermac.org/research/labs/kristin-brown .

Suitable applicants will possess a PhD (or have recently submitted their thesis) in biochemistry, molecular biology, genetics or a related discipline. A strong background in cancer research is preferred. The person will be capable of working in an independent manner within a small team, and possess high quality written and oral communication skills. Experience with transcriptomics, metabolomics and with bioinformatic analysis are essential for this role.

Remuneration is commensurate with qualifications and experience in accordance with the Allied Health Professionals (Victorian Public Health Sector) Single Interest Enterprise Agreement 2016-2020 ( 1RA6 - RESRCH ASST LV A YR6 to 1RA10 - RESRCH ASST LV A YR10).

For further information about this opportunity, please review the position description or contact us for a confidential discussion.

Job description

Cabrini

Cabrini is a Catholic charitable organisation inspired by the spirit and vision of Saint Frances Xavier Cabrini and the Missionary Sisters of the Sacred Heart of Jesus. This order was founded by Saint Frances Xavier Cabrini who was canonised in 1946 and later proclaimed Universal Patron Saint of Immigrants. We are a community of care, reaching out with compassion, integrity, courage and respect to all we serve. With more than 4300 staff, 1000 accredited medical practitioners and several locations, we offer a range of employment opportunities to start, continue or advance your career.

Allied Health

Allied Health, which represents twelve professions, is a rapidly growing and integrated service within Cabrini. Allied Health at Cabrini offers senior consultant and leadership roles; work in clinical streams; a junior staff rotation and support program; professional development and teaching opportunities; and developing strong external and university partnerships. There will be the expansion of collaborative, multi-disciplinary research with the recent appointment of a Senior Allied Health Research Consultant to support Allied Health led research.

The Role

We are seeking motivated and ethusiastic New Graduate Grade One Physiotherapists to join the Cabrini Health Team! The role is a rotating Grade One Physiotherapist position. Each rotation is 4 month duration across Cabrini acute and subacute sites. These rotations may include ICU, Surgical, Orthopaedics, Neurology, General Medical, Outpatients, Paediatrics, Rehabilitation, Chronic Disease and more. As a new graduate here at Cabrini you will have access to education, personal development and supervision from senior clinicians.

Role Requirements
  • Physiotherapy degree as well as current registration or eligibility for registration with AHPRA
  • Strong team approach and good communication skills within a multi-disciplinary team
  • Hard working and motivated to provide best patient care

Cabrini Offers
  • Salary Packaging

Cabrini is an equal opportunity employer

Cabrini is committed to providing a safe environment for children

Program Coordinator - Outpatient Program Intake (SW3, OT3, P3, Mental Health Nurse 4)

Supportive team environment

Registration with AHPRA

An exciting opportunity exists for a suitably qualified Mental Health Clinician with tertiary qualifications in appropriate disciplines (Occupational Therapy, Social Work, and Clinical Psychology) to join the Day Program therapy team. The Day Program therapy team offers evidence-based therapy treatment programs for people with a range of psychiatric conditions.

It has one of the one of the longest standing DBT Programs within Victoria and is known for its cutting edge approach to psychiatry. We are seeking a highly skilled mental health clinician to coordinate our intake and enhance continuum of care between inpatient and outpatient settings. The successful applicant will reap the professional benefits of enhancing their coordination skills, program promotion and development and be supported within a large team that is passionate about assisting patients to achieve a life worth living. 884052256:
[

Senior Data and Solutions Specialist, Executive Level 1, Economic and Analytical Services

Company Name Department of Industry, Innovation and Science Company Location Canberra, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 41 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Senior Data and Solutions Specialist is responsible for contributing to a data-driven culture at the Department of Industry, Innovation and Science by delivering, managing and providing technical advice and solutions related to data related projects including data governance and management, data and business analysis, and project and stakeholder management.

About The Team

Why join us?

Data is more valuable than ever. How data is managed and put to use will determine the effectiveness of all government agencies and many businesses. This is certainly true for the Department of Industry, Innovation and Science, as we strive for excellence in program delivery, policy development and new knowledge generation. If you want to have a direct impact on the shape of the department’s future, then read on.

The department will not complete its transition to a data-driven organisation without talented staff. Strengthening the department’s data capability requires making progress on a range of fronts. This includes impressive data analytics, stable data management, contemporary data infrastructure, data literate staff, strategic alignment of the Business Longitudinal Analysis Data Environment (BLADE), an understanding of the value of access to spatial data to drive innovation and digital economy outcomes, and strong engagement with the Australian Public Service data agenda. We need high performing people to deliver against this agenda.

The Data Management and Analytics Branch (DatMAt) resides within the Department’s Economics and Analytical Services Division. The Division is a high profile, dynamic group which supports the department and its Ministers to enable globally competitive industries. We undertake cutting edge analysis and economic research to determine what’s happening and what might happen in the economy. We also want to find out which policies work and what government can do better. We lead the department’s change journey to strengthen the department’s data driven culture and in how we apply contemporary tools and methods such as human centred design to deliver innovative policies.

Our ideal candidate

We are looking for an ongoing Executive Level 1 to support the leadership of the Data Strategy Section in the DatMAt.

The position is part of the Data Governance and Management Team, responsible for producing high quality and high impact outputs that support the data governance and management needs of the department.

You will provide essential advice, design and refine data products and service offers for business and functional teams. You will design and develop data solutions and capabilities which enable the provision of these services and products. In doing so, you will cultivate effective relationships with business, functional and technology teams including data stewards, custodians, and users.

The successful candidate for this position will be self-motivated with initiative and a team player. As well, you will have the ability to lead by example and demonstrate collaborative and constructive behaviours that influence, motivate and encourage others to achieve business outcomes.

You will influence and negotiate win-win solutions with stakeholders of all levels using your strong written and verbal communication skills, including by successfully communicating complex concepts and ideas.

You will have demonstrated high-level conceptual, analytical, technical, problem solving, lateral thinking and interpretive skills to work with raw data and develop data products, to improve business productivity and outcomes.

You Will

What you will do
  • lead the implementation and ongoing improvement of the department’s data governance and management practice to support quality enterprise data assets
  • deliver, maintain and improve DatMAt’s data services and products including:
    • the department’s Enterprise Data Model and data architecture, with a focus on improving data quality, protecting sensitive data, and influencing data-driven behaviour across the department
    • advanced data modelling processes and corresponding physical, conceptual and logical data models for the department’s data sources and repositories to support trusted data and insights
    • open data service
    • data certification process by working closely with data stewards and data custodians to enable high value datasets for management and use
    • data products including from a wide variety of sources
    • data capabilities that assist staff to develop data insights including predictive and prescriptive analytics
  • Design and develop data solutions:
    • Work with the project team to design and develop products to support the enhancement of DataHub 2.0 – the Department’s trusted source for discovering data, insights and related products and services
    • Improve the department’s metadata management practice.

Eligibility

The Following Requirements Will Be Highly Regarded
  • A Bachelor or Master’s Degree in software engineering, computer engineering, information technology, computer science, or information systems
  • Minimum of 8+ years’ demonstrated government sector experience and specialisation in data governance, management and data analysis
  • User Experience and Solution Design experience in complex environments
  • Proven specialisation and hands-on experience in relational and dimensional modelling and working with ER Studio Data Modelling Tools
  • Experience in profiling a range of data sources to produce dataset glossaries and master data, reference data and metadata management
  • Demonstrated proficiency in SQL
  • Project management and stakeholder engagement experience
  • Experience in examining current data in old legacy system, incorporating data extraction, data cleansing, data profiling and data sorting.

To be eligible for employment in the APS and the department, applicants must be Australian Citizens.

Security Clearance

This position requires a Baseline security clearance. The successful applicant will be required to obtain and maintain a clearance at this level.

Notes

This process is being used to fill one ongoing Executive Level 1 position. A merit pool will be established to fill future ongoing and non-ongoing Executive Level 1 vacancies should they become available within 12 months from the date advertised.

How To Apply

You are required to complete your application online. Aligning your responses with the above job description, provide:
  • an explanation of how your skills, knowledge and experience will be relevant to this role (limit your response to between 300 and 500 words).

You are also required to provide your current CV with your application. (CVs must be in .doc, .docx, or .pdf format).

Contact information

For more information regarding this opportunity, please contact Angkana Whiley via Angkana.Whiley@industry.gov.au or on (02) 6102 9650.

Learn More About The Department

The department’s Enterprise Agreement and policies provide for a flexible working environment to assist staff balance their work and home life. Staff and managers work together to balance the operating needs of the work unit with the needs of the individual. Options may include part time working arrangements, working from home or other arrangements as agreed by all parties.

The department is committed to a workplace culture that builds respect, fosters inclusiveness, promotes diversity, embraces the unique skills and qualities of all our employees and is committed to attracting, recruiting and retaining people with disability. If you require some assistance with your application please contact the Recruitment Team at recruitment@industry.gov.au or (02) 6276 1235 or refer to our Applying for a position information.

Select the links on the left-hand side of the page for more useful information about a career with the Department of Industry, Innovation and Science.

Industry

  • Government Administration

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Information Technology

Trauma Team Training Coordinator

Company Name Alfred Health Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 17 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Job description

Alfred Health

Alfred Health is a leader in health care delivery, improvement, research and education. We are the main provider of health services to people living in the inner southeast suburbs of Melbourne, from ambulatory, to inpatient and home and community based services.

Trauma Team Training Coordinator

About Us

With a mission to improve care of the injured, the National Trauma Research Institute (NTRI) was established in 2003 by partnership institutions Alfred Health and Monash University. The NTRI is located with the Alfred Medical Research and Education Precinct (AMREP) at The Alfred campus in Melbourne, Australia and supports the Trauma Services clinical unit’s education and research activities.

The NTRI works with organisations nationally and internationally to prevent and reduce the impact of severe injury by integrating research, education, biotechnologies and trauma systems development - to improve clinical care and outcomes. In early 2016 the NTRI’s activities were combined with those of The Alfred Trauma Service to integrate research with patient outcomes and to improve efficiency.

Position Summary

A Trauma Team Training Coordinator is required 3 days per week (24 hours/week) to coordinate and deliver our Trauma Team Reception and Resuscitation Training Program in 1 adult major Trauma Centre and 5 regional Trauma Centres in Victoria for staff involved in trauma reception and resuscitation. This 2-year project is funded by TAC and led by Professor Mark Fitzgerald, Director of Trauma and The National Trauma Research Institute.

Qualifications/Experience
  • Registered Nurse (Div 1) with Post Grad Qualifications; preferably Critical Care, ED/Trauma Experience.
  • Demonstrated experience coordinating clinical training programs.
  • Previous experience with Project Management/Coordination and associated administrative work.

Key Capabilities
  • Demonstrated experience coordinating clinical training programs
  • Demonstrated program coordination skills including facilitation and delivery of presentations
  • Demonstrated high level organisational, administrative and time management skill
Applications for this role are to contact Kim Williams on 9076 8810 and or Dr Joesph Mathew on 9076 3405

Alfred Health is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce that reflects the community we serve. Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders are encouraged.
